reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Iron gate is a unique gem of a hotel, literally a few steps from the old town square in Prague. It is an old coaching house and all of the rooms are individually decorated but include all the old painted beams that were in the building in the 1300s. The entrance is through an arched gateway, where the hotel limo service (very cheap) will drop you off. You will go through a fantastic courtyard to get to your room (it would be fantastic in summer, but as it snowed when we were there we weren't complaining!) All the staff were incredibly friendly and willing to help, and also had a good knowledge of English. Very clean with loads of pillows and extra bedding if so required. Our room was on the second floor and you walked straight into the bedroom that was very lush - all royal blue and crisp white. You then went down 3 steps to an enormous living area that had a full 3 seater settee, dining table, television and what looked like a massive wardrobe. On opening the wardrobe it actually contained a small 'kitchenette', complete with fridge (with drinks etc), sink, grill and small hob. Our bathroom was an experience in itself. As you walked in you thought it was the same height as a normal room, but on looking up the ceiling was about 20 foot above you. It was decorated in plain white but the the exposed beams travelling up the walls to a massive open skylight in the ceiling gave it an amazing feeling of space. Absolutely fantastic! I would highly recommend the Iron Gate to anyone travelling to Prague.
reviews.title: Romantic,historical and brilliantly positioned!
Fantastic!
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and the hotel was clean and location ideal. Rooms are nicely appointed and staff is very friendly and courteous. The location in old town cannot be beat. We paid 180 Euro (roughly$250 American) per night and it included breakfast and all taxes. I would definitely go back. This is a boutique hotel with a lot of charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel in the middle of Old Town of Prague. 1 minute walk to the old City hall; 5 minutes walk to the New Town (Wenceslass) and also 5 minutes walk to the Charles Bridge.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Staff is friendly. The rooms are large, clean and tidy, with painted ceilings.
reviews.title: Excelent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a buffet. You can eat in- or outside. (room-service is also possible)
reviews.title: Outstanding Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I' decided to book a four day stay in Prague as a surprise fro my boyfriend's birthday. i booked this hotel because of the rave reviews and I wasnt disappointed! This hotel was so beautiful and right in the centre of Prague. You literally came out of the front door, turned left and there was the Old Town square. The location is second to none.
reviews.title: This hotel is amazing!

reviews.text: What can I say about the hotel?! Wow. The staff were very friendly and they couldn't do enough to help you. We booked a deluxe suite and it was fantastic, amazing original painted ceiling, living room and separate bedroom and the bathroom...oh my god!
reviews.title: Spacious clean room, fabulous location!

reviews.text: A nice touch was on our first night in the hotel the staff brought us a free bottle of champagne because it was my boyfriends birthday, I didn't ask for this and I thought it was a lovely touch. The hotel in immaculate and i couldn't fault it all. If you want to make your stay in Prague more amazing book this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the long easter weekend with our two young children (3yr old and 10 mo. old) and were very happy with our choice
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: of hotels. The suite was very large and had enough room for our buggies and baby gear and a baby cot was in the room on our arrival.
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't add any more than that already has been said, apart from: this really is the best location in Prague. If you really want to be treated like a human being, a paying guest, an individual and you want to feel that you are the only guest, and somewhere where the staff members can't do enough for you, then stay here. If you want to stay at a chain where they only think about themselves then don't stay here. Prague is one of the world's most lovely places and this hotel makes it all the more wonderful.
reviews.title: Location,location,location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Iron Gate Hotel for 3 nights from 18th Nov and loved it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Location

likes.liked: — Location for tourists, mixture of modern decor with classic features
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything - it really was ideal for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was huge for the two of us. We walked straight into the bedroom, with a great sized, modern bathroom leading off. Down 5 or 6 stairs from the bedroom into the lounge area with a comfy sofa and chair, table and chairs, and a small kitchenette (including sink, microwave, kettle and minibar) built into what looks like a wardrobe.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, we will go back again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provides a seperate room near reception, just off the courtyard, with internet access, locked, but with a key attached to your room key. Breakfast - continental plus a few extras including made-to-order pancakes - was served in Cafe Bogner, and was ample to get the day started. The hotel also has a restaurant which has recently been converted into an Indian, but can't comment because we didn't eat there.
reviews.title: Try not to change!

likes.liked: — Did not feel like a hotel
likes.disliked: — Fill up with breakfast, walk your feet off then soak in the jaccuzi....then start again..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located 2-3 minutes walk from the Astronomic Clock corner of the Old Square, and between 5-10 minutes to the Charles Bridge. Dozens of bars and restaurants also lie within about 10 minutes walk, so for our needs on our first trip to Prague, this was a perfect location.
reviews.title: Pretty,central and friendly

likes.disliked: — Getting wet on the way to breakfast if it rained

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, would definately go back
reviews.text: My boyfriend booked this hotel at a low rate in January 2007 as an Xmas pressie. Was a bit apprehensive about going but when we got there it was lovely. Because it was so much cheaper in January we were able to book the Royal Suite which had original painted beams, large bathroom although they could have made more use of the room in here and put a bigger bath in (thats if your staying in the Royal Suite), huge wardrobe, seating area with sofa, dining table and a quirky cabinet which when opened lit up and turned into a small kitchenette with sink, kettle, coffee maker and a fridge. Breakfast was ok with a lot to choose from but if you like your English tea be sure to bring your own teabags to breakfast as they only provide Earl Grey or herbal teas! They did have a restaurant in the hotel but we didnt try it as it was actually a curry house so hardly catered for everyone's taste! I would say that was the only downside but as you probably wouldnt spend much time in the hotel it didnt matter. Staff were polite and helpful. Our hotel was in a great location and once you stepped out into the cobbled back streets you were only a 5 minute walk from the main square. Our room overlooked a main street but it was very quiet although I suspect you notice noise more in the summer. The air con wasnt great in the room but we didnt really need it. The streets are fairly narrow so you can see across the road into the building opposite, again be warned if going in the summer when you might find a lot of crowds flocking for hen/stag parties! I think Prague was lovely and although cold, we probably went the best time of the year. If I ever went back I would stay here again.

reviews.title: 5th star is for location
reviews.text: We stayed there for 5 nights with our 10-year old son and had a great time. The room - "everest room" in terms of a web booking agency - was very nice with two rooms, two tv's, kitchenette hidden in a closet and generally with furniture in the style as from my grandmothers time had she been a bit wealthier.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great bath tub, friendly and professional staff, 1st class cleaning. Best of all: Extremely nice location, just seconds from the astronomical watch and a multitude of crystal shops, bars, restaurants etc. and with Charles Bridge within reach in a few minutes. One lazy evening we just picked up some pizza and borrowed from the reception Crocodile Dundee 1+2 for the dvd-player in the room. Holiday at its best!
reviews.title: Fantastic in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful 3 nights here. It was our first trip abroad together so we wanted something special and were not dissapointed.
reviews.title: just what we wanted for three nights

likes.liked: — Size of suite and huge bed. Good temperature control

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location (1 minute from the old Town Square) and yet it was still quiet at night. The hotel doesn't look much from the outside ( we nearly walked past it!!) but once inside it's beautiful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
